instructions: Open Contacts and then tap the name of the contact you want to delete. Tap Edit at the top-right of the screen. Scroll down and tap Delete Contact , then tap Delete Contact again to confirm.
Go to the Apple menu and click on System Preferences > iCloud . Sign in with your Apple ID and check Contacts so that they will sync across your devices.

Open the Contacts app on your Mac. Select All Contacts . Hold down the Command button on your keyboard and select all the contacts you want to delete. Right-click and click Delete Cards to erase all their info. Confirm by clicking on Delete .

Install and open the Groups app on your iPhone. Skip the intro screen and allow Groups access to your contacts when prompted. Select All Contacts from the Groups list. Scroll through your contacts and mark the ones you d like to delete by tapping on the circle to the left of their name. Tap Choose Action at the top and tap on Delete Contacts from the menu. Confirm again with a tap on Remove from my iPhone! to remove your selected contacts.

Install and open the Cleanup Duplicate Contacts app. Allow the app to access your contacts. Tap on Contacts. Next, tap on the Pencil icon to edit the list. Then scroll down the list and select the contacts to remove. Tap on the Delete icon at the bottom of the list. Confirm the deletion.
